00033 /* =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
00034  *   BSP (Board Support Package)
00035  *   Target : Texas Instruments EZ430-RF2500
00036  *            "MSP430 Wireless Development Tool"
00037  *   Top-level board code file.
00038  * =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
00039  */
00040 
00041 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00042  *                                            Includes
00043  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00044  */
00045 #include "bsp.h"
00046 #include "bsp_config.h"
00047 
00048 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049  *                                            Prototypes
00050  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051  */
00052 
00053 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054  *                                            Defines
00055  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00056  */
00057 #define BSP_TIMER_CLK_MHZ   (BSP_CONFIG_CLOCK_MHZ_SELECT)
00058 
00059 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00060  *                                            Local Variables
00061  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00062  */
00063 #if defined(SW_TIMER)
00064 static uint8_t sIterationsPerUsec = 0;
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 /**************************************************************************************************
00068  * @fn          BSP_EARLY_INIT
00069  *
00070  * @brief       This function is called by start-up code before doing the normal initialization
00071  *              of data segments. If the return value is zero, initialization is not performed.
00072  *              The global macro label "BSP_EARLY_INIT" gets #defined in the bsp_msp430_defs.h
00073  *              file, according to the specific compiler environment (CCE or IAR). In the CCE
00074  *              environment this macro invokes "_system_pre_init()" and in the IAR environment
00075  *              this macro invokes "__low_level_init()".
00076  *
00077  * @param       None
00078  *
00079  * @return      0 - don't intialize data segments / 1 - do initialization
00080  **************************************************************************************************
00081 */
00082 BSP_EARLY_INIT(void)
00083 {
00084   /* Disable watchdog timer */
00085   WDTCTL = WDTPW | WDTHOLD;
00086 
00087   /* Return 1 - run seg_init */
00088   return (1);
00089 }
00090 
00091 /**************************************************************************************************
00092  * @fn          BSP_InitBoard
00093  *
00094  * @brief       Initialize the board.
00095  *
00096  * @param       none
00097  *
00098  * @return      none
00099  **************************************************************************************************
00100  */
00101 void BSP_InitBoard(void)
00102 {
00103   /* configure internal digitally controlled oscillator */
00104   DCOCTL  = BSP_CONFIG_MSP430_DCOCTL;
00105   BCSCTL1 = BSP_CONFIG_MSP430_BCSCTL1;
00106 
00107   /* Configure TimerA for use by the delay function */
00108 
00109   /* Reset the timer */
00110   TACTL |= TACLR; /* Set the TACLR */
00111 
00112   /* Clear all settings */
00113   TACTL = 0x0;
00114 
00115   /* Select the clk source to be - SMCLK (Sub-Main CLK)*/
00116   TACTL |= TASSEL_2;
00117 
00118 #if defined(SW_TIMER)
00119 #define MHZ_CLOCKS_PER_USEC      BSP_CLOCK_MHZ
00120 #define MHZ_CLOCKS_PER_ITERATION 10
00121 
00122   sIterationsPerUsec = (uint8_t)(((MHZ_CLOCKS_PER_USEC)/(MHZ_CLOCKS_PER_ITERATION))+.5);
00123 
00124   if (!sIterationsPerUsec)
00125   {
00126     sIterationsPerUsec = 1;
00127   }
00128 #endif   /* SW_TIMER */
00129 }
00130 
00131 /**************************************************************************************************
00132  * @fn          BSP_Delay
00133  *
00134  * @brief       Sleep for the requested amount of time.
00135  *
00136  * @param       # of microseconds to sleep.
00137  *
00138  * @return      none
00139  **************************************************************************************************
00140  */
00141 void BSP_Delay(uint16_t usec)
00142 #if !defined(SW_TIMER)
00143 {
00144 
00145   TAR = 0; /* initial count */
00146   TACCR0 = BSP_TIMER_CLK_MHZ*usec; /* compare count. (delay in ticks) */
00147 
00148   /* Start the timer in UP mode */
00149   TACTL |= MC_1;
00150 
00151   /* Loop till compare interrupt flag is set */
00152   while(!(TACCTL0 & CCIFG));
00153 
00154   /* Stop the timer */
00155   TACTL &= ~(MC_1);
00156 
00157   /* Clear the interrupt flag */
00158    TACCTL0 &= ~CCIFG;
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 #else  /* !SW_TIMER */
00163 
00164 
00165 {
00166   /* Declared 'volatile' in case User optimizes for speed. This will
00167    * prevent the optimizer from eliminating the loop completely. But
00168    * it also generates more code...
00169    */
00170   volatile uint16_t repeatCount = sIterationsPerUsec*usec;
00171 
00172   while (repeatCount--) ;
00173 
00174   return;
00175 }
00176 
00177 #endif  /* !SW_TIMER */
00178 /**************************************************************************************************
00179 */
00180 
00181
